name: Maintainn Tools
author: Maintainn

sections.description:
For years, Maintainn has helped thousands of clients keep their websites updated and secured. During that time, we’ve built a number of tools to help us do just that. With the Maintainn Tools plugin, we’re making a number of those tools available to you!

Site Info: See a top level view of your entire WordPress install. View registered post types and post statuses, permalink structure, multisite network active plugins, active and inactive plugins, must-use plugins (MU), site and server details, browser details, and session details. You can easily email the results to yourself or your support team.

Site Scanner: Compare the WordPress Core files on your website hosting server to the current WordPress files available from the WordPress.org repository to ensure they have not been altered in any way.

Manage Plugins:Turn on/off automatic updates for individual plugins. Easily lock specific plugins from being updated.

Plugin Admin Notes: Add notes next to each plugin.
sections.installation:
Admin Installer via search

  1. Visit the Add New plugin screen and search for “maintainn tools”.
  2. Click the “Install Now” button.
  3. Activate the plugin.
  4. Navigate to the “Maintainn” Menu.

Admin Installer via zip

  1. Visit the Add New plugin screen and click the “Upload Plugin” button.
  2. Click the “Browse…” button and select zip file from your computer.
  3. Click “Install Now” button.
  4. Once done uploading, activate Maintainn Tools.

Manual

  1. Upload the Maintainn Tools folder to the plugins directory in your WordPress installation.
  2. Activate the plugin.
  3. Navigate to the “Maintainn” Menu.

That’s it!
sections.changelog:
2.3.4

  • Fixed: various potential security issues.

2.3.3

  • Fixed: Styling issues with announcement metabox
  • Fixed: More appropriate option defaults when no user-saved options exist yet.

2.3.2

  • Update: more style touchups discovered after our first announcement.

2.3.1

  • Update: style touchups to make an announcement show better.

2.3.0

  • Added: Support for announcements from Maintainn.com within the Dashboard Widget. Props @donmhico
  • Updated: Adjusted styles for the Dashboard Widget. Props @amethystanswers

2.2.0

  • Site Health integration

2.1.0

  • Added: Ability to delete notes left on an individual plugin.
  • Added: Display folder size for wp-content/upload, database size, and disk space usage.
  • Added: ABSPATH value to PHP/server info panel.
  • Added: Checkmark indication for tools activation and deactivation.
  • Updated: Support tab with additional helpful content.

2.0.4

  • Added: Registered image sizes information in site info tab and emailed site info content.
  • Fixed: Prevent maintainn-notes post type from showing in Yoast SEO Content Types section.
  • Fixed: About Page Layout changes.
  • Fixed: Support Page Layout changes and CSS updates.
  • Updated: WordPress core post types now link to .org page inside of Registered Post Types view on the site info tab.
  • Removed: Unused code from legacy version of plugin.

2.0.3

  • Fixed: Issue regarding conditional loading of Maintainn Tools-specific javascript on editor screens.

2.0.2

  • Fixed: Typo in WP core function that prevented emailing of system content.
  • Fixed: Issue around incorrect slug being disabled or enabled in admin notes.

2.0.1

  • Fixing some text

2.0

  • Initial public plugin release

short_description: A plugin to Maintainn your WordPress website
description:
For years, Maintainn has helped thousands of clients keep their websites updated and secured. During that time, we’ve built a number of tools to help us do just that. With the Maintainn Tools plugin, we’re making a number of those tools available to you!

Site Info: See a top level view of your entire WordPress install. View registered post types and post statuses, permalink structure, multisite network active plugins, active and inactive plugins, must-use plugins (MU), site and server details, browser details, and session details. You can easily email the results to yourself or your support team.

Site Scanner: Compare the WordPress Core files on your website hosting server to the current WordPress files available from the WordPress.org repository to ensure they have not been altered in any way.

Manage Plugins:Turn on/off automatic updates for individual plugins. Easily lock specific plugins from being updated.

screenshots.caption: The Site Info tab provides a wealth of information about your website and the server it's running on.
The Tools tab lets you turn on and off features in the Maintainn Tools plugin.
The Plugin Admin Notes tool allows you to leave notes, disable updates, or turn on automatic upates for each plugin installed on your site.
The handy dashboard widget gives you quick access to all of the Maintainn Tools.
